Notable attempts at reform and/or justic: Officer charged with involuntary manslaughter, civilian oversight body, mandatory body cameras, crisis intervention training
DOJ civil rights case filed against George Zimmerman (ending in an acquital), beginning of the #BlackLivesMatter movement, NAACP proposes principles called "Trayvon's Law"
Required 3-day training on deescalation, implemented bias training, body cameras, new process of force documentation, reduced stop and frisk , Eric Garner Chokehold Act passed on June 8, 2020 in NYS
DOJ consent decree of Ferguson PD required hundreds of changes, 6 officials resigned or were fired, creation of President's Task force on 21st Century Policing
Use of force training, crisis intervention training, new dispatch system, DOJ consent decree
Officer sentenced to 20 years in prison by fed government, "Walter Scott Notification Act" was proposed and yet to be passed
DOJ consent decree of Baltimore PD, revision of use of force policies, body cameras and officer misconduct
Sandra Bland Act - changes to bail reform, jail diversion, jail safety, officer training, racial profiling, data collection, officer discipline and behavioral health
Conviction of officer, firing of Superintendent and Head of IPRA, formation of Civilian Office of Police Accountability, eventual consent decree of Chicago PD
Ceasing of the use of grand juries in police shootings
Required training, decertification of 26 police officers
DOJ investigation, rewrote use of force policies
Ban of chokeholds, required intervention during unauthorized use of force, loss of community contracts, vote to disband the police
